name: data-table-contacts
title: Contacts Data Table with Supabase
description: A complete contacts data table with sorting, filtering, pagination, and row selection. Includes column management and action menus. Integrated with Supabase for real-time data fetching and management.

files.content:
# Supabase Configuration
# Get these from your Supabase project settings > API
NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL=your_supabase_project_url
NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=your_supabase_anon_key

# Example:
# NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL=https://your-project-ref.supabase.co
# NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...

-- Create the contacts table for the data table example
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS registry_contacts (
    id UUID DEFAULT gen_random_uuid() PRIMARY KEY,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    first_name TEXT,
    last_name TEXT,
    display_name TEXT,
    nickname TEXT,
    primary_email TEXT,
    primary_phone TEXT,
    company TEXT,
    job_title TEXT,
    birthday DATE,
    notes TEXT,
    is_favorite BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    tags TEXT[]
);

-- Create an index on commonly searched fields
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_registry_contacts_name ON registry_contacts(first_name, last_name);
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_registry_contacts_email ON registry_contacts(primary_email);
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_registry_contacts_company ON registry_contacts(company);

-- Insert sample data
INSERT INTO registry_contacts (
    first_name, last_name, display_name, nickname, primary_email, primary_phone, 
    company, job_title, birthday, notes, is_favorite, tags
) VALUES 
    ('Alice', 'Johnson', 'Alice Johnson', 'Ally', 'alice.johnson@acme.com', '2125551200', 'Acme Inc.', 'Software Engineer', '1990-03-12', 'Loves hiking and cats.', true, ARRAY['engineering', 'hiking']),
    ('Brian', 'Wong', 'Brian Wong', 'Bri', 'brian.wong@starventures.io', '3105559876', 'Star Ventures', 'Product Manager', '1987-08-19', 'Interested in AI and blockchain.', false, ARRAY['product', 'ai']),
    ('Camila', 'Santos', 'Camila Santos', null, 'camila.santos@fintech.co', '6465553344', 'FinTech Co.', 'Data Analyst', '1992-02-05', 'Speaks fluent Spanish and French.', true, ARRAY['analytics']),
    ('Daniel', 'Lee', 'Daniel Lee', 'Dan', 'dan.lee@healthsolutions.com', '4085557766', 'Health Solutions', 'Operations Manager', '1985-09-17', 'Enjoys tennis and weekend trips.', false, ARRAY['ops']),
    ('Elena', 'Martinez', 'Elena Martinez', null, 'elena.martinez@globalco.com', '3125550101', 'GlobalCo', 'Marketing Director', '1979-06-23', 'Responsible for global brand strategy.', true, ARRAY['marketing'])
ON CONFLICT (id) DO NOTHING;

-- Enable Row Level Security (optional - uncomment if needed)
-- ALTER TABLE registry_contacts ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;

-- Create a policy that allows all operations (adjust as needed for your use case)
-- CREATE POLICY "Allow all operations on registry_contacts" ON registry_contacts FOR ALL USING (true);

# Supabase Data Table Setup This data table component integrates with Supabase for real-time data fetching and management. ## Prerequisites - A Supabase project - Next.js 13+ with App Router - Node.js 18+ ## Setup Instructions ### 1. Environment Variables Copy the `.env.example` file to `.env.local` in your project root: ```bash cp .env.example .env.local ``` Then update `.env.local` with your Supabase credentials: ```env NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL=https://your-project-ref.supabase.co NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=your_supabase_anon_key ``` Get these values from your Supabase project dashboard: 1. Go to your Supabase project 2. Navigate to Settings > API 3. Copy the Project URL and anon/public key ### 2. Database Setup Run the SQL commands in `database.sql` in your Supabase SQL editor: 1. Go to your Supabase project dashboard 2. Navigate to SQL Editor 3. Copy and paste the contents of `database.sql` 4. Run the query to create the `registry_contacts` table and sample data ### 3. Middleware Setup If you don't already have a `middleware.ts` file in your project root, copy the provided `middleware.ts` file there. If you already have middleware, merge the Supabase session handling with your existing middleware: ```typescript import { updateSession } from '@/lib/supabase/middleware' export async function middleware(request: NextRequest) { // Your existing middleware logic... // Add Supabase session handling return await updateSession(request) } ``` ### 4. TypeScript Configuration Make sure your `tsconfig.json` includes the lib directory: ```json { "compilerOptions": { "baseUrl": ".", "paths": { "@/*": ["./src/*"] } } } ``` ## Usage After setup, you can use the data table component: ```tsx import { DataTableExampleContacts } from '@/components/data-table-example-contacts/data-table-example-contacts' export default function ContactsPage() { return (
) } ``` ## Database Schema The contacts table includes the following fields: - `id` (UUID, Primary Key) - `created_at` (Timestamp) - `updated_at` (Timestamp) - `first_name` (Text) - `last_name` (Text) - `display_name` (Text) - `nickname` (Text, nullable) - `primary_email` (Text) - `primary_phone` (Text) - `company` (Text) - `job_title` (Text) - `birthday` (Date) - `notes` (Text) - `is_favorite` (Boolean) - `tags` (Text Array) ## Customization You can customize the data table by: 1. Modifying the `Contacts` type in the component 2. Updating the columns configuration 3. Adding custom filters and sorting options 4. Extending the database schema as needed ## Troubleshooting ### Common Issues 1. **Environment variables not loading**: Make sure your `.env.local` file is in the project root and restart your development server. 2. **Database connection errors**: Verify your Supabase URL and anon key are correct. 3. **Table not found**: Ensure you've run the database setup SQL commands. 4. **Middleware conflicts**: If you have existing middleware, make sure to properly merge the Supabase session handling. ### Getting Help - [Supabase Documentation](https://supabase.com/docs) - [Next.js App Router Guide](https://nextjs.org/docs/app) - [shadcn/ui Documentation](https://ui.shadcn.com)

import { Column } from "@tanstack/react-table" import { ArrowDown, ArrowUp, ChevronsUpDown, EyeOff } from "lucide-react" import { cn } from "@/lib/utils" import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button" import { DropdownMenu, DropdownMenuContent, DropdownMenuItem, DropdownMenuSeparator, DropdownMenuTrigger, } from "@/components/ui/dropdown-menu" interface DataTableColumnHeaderProps extends React.HTMLAttributes { column: Column title: string } export function DataTableColumnHeader({ column, title, className, }: DataTableColumnHeaderProps) { if (!column.getCanSort()) { return
{title}
} return (
column.toggleSorting(false)}> Asc column.toggleSorting(true)}> Desc column.toggleVisibility(false)}> Hide
) }

docs:
Setup Instructions:

1. Copy .env.example to .env.local and add your Supabase credentials
2. Run the database.sql script in your Supabase SQL editor to create the contacts table
3. Copy middleware.ts to your project root (or merge with existing middleware)
4. Ensure your tsconfig.json paths are configured correctly

See README.md for detailed setup instructions and troubleshooting.
